result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Current: N2639 County Rd Z, E89, Dousman, WI 53118 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: Unknown,

MODIFICATION MADE ON 10/24/2022:
Court will allow possession of alcoholic beverage for use of employment. 

COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND. 
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (EXCEPTION for contact for victim B: though any family case orders out of Milwaukee County case 22FA3089 or through Our Family Wizard ONLY for the sole purpose of the custody and placement of the minor child(ren)) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

9:39 AM Defendant Megan A Smith in court.  Attorney Alexis Garuz in court for Megan A Smith. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

Defense had previously filed a bail motion. 
State reviews motion and is ready to proceed today. 
Defense requests to modify bond to allow the Defendant to possess alcohol for the use of employment. 
State does not object, but requests that absolute sobriety remain. 

Court will order modification of bond for possession of alcoholic beverage for use of employment. 
 
Defense has discovery, and ask the State if there are any recorded statements. Defense does not have an offer at this time. Defense requests to set a hearing after initial appearance on 22CM1881, that is currently set for 11/03/2022. 

State notes there is no PTO on file, and has no information on recordings. Defense to follow up with charging DA.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Garuz

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/20/2022 - Will address on 10/24/2022.**

9:15 AM Defendant Megan A Smith in court.  Attorney Alexis Garuz in court for Megan A Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
